map.graph.directed

Interface IDirectedGraph

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DirectedGraph

    public interface IDirectedGraph
    Interface for the directed graph witch represented the pipe capacity of the streets and flow direction. Input always one Node more. e.g a Graph with 36 Nodes initialize the graph with 37
    Author:
    Josef Weldemariam, Matr. 7316168

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Node> getNodes()
      returns a list with all nodes.
      java.lang.Integer getWeight(int i, int j)
      returns the weight of the edge between Node i and Node j with flow direction i->j 0 for no edge
      void setWeight(int i, int j, java.lang.Integer b)
      sets the weight of the edge between Node i and Node j with flow direction i->j 0 for no edge

    • Method Detail

      • getNodes

        java.util.ArrayList<Node> getNodes()
        returns a list with all nodes. A node represent the north western field of a square of four fields on a crossing
        Returns:
        list of nodes

      • getWeight

        java.lang.Integer getWeight(int i,
                            int j)
        returns the weight of the edge between Node i and Node j with flow direction i->j 0 for no edge
        Parameters:
        i - Node number i
        j - Node number j
        Returns:
        weight of the edge

      • setWeight

        void setWeight(int i,
               int j,
               java.lang.Integer b)
        sets the weight of the edge between Node i and Node j with flow direction i->j 0 for no edge
        Parameters:
        i - Node number i
        j - Node number j
        b - weight of the edge
